info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 27 at 4:41AM EDT until May 28 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River At Asheville affecting Buncombe County. French Broad River At Marshall affecting Madison County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...French Broad River At Marshall. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, The French Broad River is starting to flood low-lying areas on Blannahassett Island. Low-lying areas along Hayes Run Creek in the Rollins area are beginning to flood. At 8.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. The French Broad River is approaching some buildings on Blannahassett Island and approaching residential yards along Island Road. Minor flooding along Rollins Road is likely. The river is approaching the railroad tracks in the Back Street area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:16 AM EDT Friday the stage was 7.8 feet and rising steadily. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above Minor Flood Stage early this morning and is expected to crest around 8.3 feet by 8am. It will then fall below Minor Flood Stage this evening and below Action/Advisory Stage by early Saturday morning. - Action/Advisory Stage is 7.5 feet. - Minor Flood Stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp
